p:
An increase in the frequency and intensity of severe heat events due to anthropogenic emissions has been observed across the globe
1– 5 . India has been substantially affected by deadly heatwaves in the past due to the warming climate and increasing population
5– 11 . For instance, heatwaves during 1998 and 2015 caused more than 2000 deaths each in India. More importantly, exposure to the severe heatwaves
5 , heat stress
6, 7 , and heat-related mortality
8 in India are projected to increase significantly in the future.
